column4: i can ssh to my machine but rsync isn't working... any reasons i could be having this problem?
is rsync installed?
yes
also what is the command you use to invoke rsync
my rsync command is a few lines up
are you using rsync over ssh or rsyncd?
cos that command requires that you run rsyncd on the remote.
here is how i do it rsync -avPe ssh someuser@x.y.z.w:/home/somethingto/backup .
that's the same thing i'm doing... the only difference is the -P which wouldn't matter...
where have you asked it to use ssh in that command?
and if you did you wouldnt need to specify the port (only in 'ssh -p non-standard-port)
i told you i tried the --rsh=ssh which is the same as -e ssh
and i have to specify a non-standard port because i don't have a daemon listening on a standard one
so what errors are you getting?
my crystal ball is a little fuzzy right now
which is why you need to specify the port in rsync -e 'ssh -p 1234' and not outside
you didnt read the Manual first? r
back in 1995 i read the manual... haven't needed to since then
ah good for you;
so does it work now like it should?
you're welcome
must be because i'm going through a couple firewalls and this free attnet free wifi must be complicating things... and thanks
pastebinit also does it
i'm sure it, and at least 5 other apps probably do it
